result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Addison Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED. Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victims Esther D., Ashley D., or KNA dob 1/27/2005.
No firearms; weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and anger management and continued programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully compete any other ocunseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Cout advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing APRIL 17, 2014 received and filed. (43 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  INSTITUTION.

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO COUNT #4: (w/o repeater enhancer), Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.  

 AS TO COUNT #2: (w/o repeater enhancer), the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentences, with credit for 87 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

 AS TO COUNT #3: (w/o repeater enhancer), the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.   

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling AND Anger Management, 
    and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victims, Esther D., Ashley D., 
   or KNA (d.o.b. 1-27-2005) 
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
  and pay all appropriate costs.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees 
   as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Costs apply to all counts (case 2014CF264) 
   and (case 2013CF792).
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 AS TO COUNTS #2, #3 and #4: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the repeater enhancer.
 
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #5, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case 2013CF1904 dismissed and read-in to cases 2013CF792 and 2014CF264 for the purposes of sentencing.    

 AS TO COUNTS #2, #3 and #4 (without the repeater enhancer).  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  PSI is not being requested.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-17-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered defendant remanded until the date of sentencing.   mld

Attorney Kiley Zellner in court, defendant Allen Addison not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Upon the request of both parties, Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 rescheduled from 2-21-2014 at 8:30 am to 2-21-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Packet of discovery received by defense counsel.  

On the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: 2013CF792, 2013CF1904 and 2014CF264.  Defense counsel is not opposed to the consolidation of cases.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-21-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on  3-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  

Court heard and granted the Motion of the State for an Order Revoking Defendant's mail privilieges, phone and visitation privileges.  Defense is opposed to the motion of the State. The State to draft an order for the Court.   mld

Defendant Allen Addison in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Allen Addison in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04 due to lower pending case rule. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
